strong.span: COVID-19: Distance learning for remainder of school year

hr.p: All 13 Sacramento County school districts, including Folsom Cordova, have agreed to keep their campuses closed through the end of the school year to jointly support the coronavirus mitigation effort. The decision was made in consultation with Sacramento County Public Health.
Campuses will remain closed for the rest of the school year, but school is still in session: Our plans for distance learning continue.
Distance learning: For information on accessing our learning platform, Schoology, visit www.fcusd.org/tech.
Please continue to check this website for updates on distance learning, meals for students in need, and other common questions: www.fcusd.org/coronavirus

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus: Updates

p.strong: Please follow the link below for assistance logging into and using Schoology:

hr.p: This link takes you to the Education Technology & Information Department's web site for general help and assistance for parents and students with logging into Schoology.

p.strong: Please use the link below as a shortcut to log into FCUSD's Schoology LMS:

hr.p: This link is also on the home page to every school web site under Additional Links.

a.title: Go to comments for Schoology Help Info

strong.span: CTC Accreditation: Enlisting Third Party Comments

p.span: Folsom Cordova Unified School District is seeking initial institutional approval by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing. This approval would allow the Folsom Cordova Unified School District to sponsor educator preparation programs in California. Interested parties are invited to submit comments to the Commission at

. Please note that comments must address substantive matters related to the quality of professional education programs offered, and should specify the party’s relationship to the institution (i.e., graduate, present or former faculty member, employer of graduates). All identifying information will remain confidential.
Mindy Andrus, Teacher Induction Program Coordinator

a.title: Go to comments for CTC Induction Accreditation 3rd party comments (do not remove)

img.alt: WeTIP - report crimes

p.span: … you can call this number 24 hours a day and report your concerns to us.

span.span: No one will ask your name, you will remain anonymous.

img.alt: Angela Griffin Ankhelyi, APR: New Director of Communication and Community Engagement

a.span: Angela Griffin Ankhelyi, APR: New Director of Communication and Community Engagement

div.p: Announced at the April 14, Board Meeting, Griffin Ankhelyi will begin as Director of Communication and Community Engagement immediately.

a.title: Go to comments for Angela Griffin Ankhelyi, APR: New Director of Communication and Community Engagement

img.alt: Budget Update: Board continues dialogue at Feb. 27 study session

a.span: Budget Update: Board continues dialogue at Feb. 27 study session

div.p: The Folsom Cordova Board of Education will resume its public dialogue on potential solutions to the District’s estimated $4.4 million budget deficit during its next study session. The Board is not voting on any recommended cuts at this meeting.

a.title: Go to comments for Budget Update: Board continues dialogue at Feb. 27 study session

img.alt: Middle school teacher named national master teacher, working with Library of Congress

a.span: Middle school teacher named national master teacher, working with Library of Congress

div.p: Local teacher works with Library of Congress to help develop resources for better access...

a.title: Go to comments for Middle school teacher named national master teacher, working with Library of Congress

img.alt: Parent voices: Folsom Cordova families learn how to explore school stats

a.span: Parent voices: Folsom Cordova families learn how to explore school stats

div.p: More than 50 Folsom Cordova parents and caregivers gathered together at Rancho Cordova Elementary on a sunny Saturday morning on Feb. 8 to learn about the California School Dashboard and how they can look up information about their schools’ performance.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent voices: Folsom Cordova families learn how to explore school stats

img.alt: Partner spotlight: Kinney, Walnutwood students become published authors

a.span: Partner spotlight: Kinney, Walnutwood students become published authors

div.p: A Community Enhancement Fund grant from the City of Rancho Cordova helped local partner 916 Ink transform students at both schools into confident writers and published authors. Both schools recently held book release parties for their campus communities.

a.title: Go to comments for Partner spotlight: Kinney, Walnutwood students become published authors

img.alt: Community celebrates groundbreaking of Mangini Ranch Elementary

a.span: Community celebrates groundbreaking of Mangini Ranch Elementary

div.p: More than 100 residents, future students, community leaders, members of #TeamFCUSD - and Folsom’s Mangini family - celebrated the groundbreaking of Mangini Ranch Elementary School on Wednesday, Feb. 12.

a.title: Go to comments for Community celebrates groundbreaking of Mangini Ranch Elementary

img.alt: High school students put real-world skills on display at regional competition

a.span: High school students put real-world skills on display at regional competition

div.p: FCUSD students showcased skill and talent at regional competition, with many coming away with awards.

a.title: Go to comments for High school students put real-world skills on display at regional competition

img.alt: You're invited: 2020 State of our Schools breakfast Feb. 25

a.span: You're invited: 2020 State of our Schools breakfast Feb. 25

div.p: Folsom Cordova Unified continues to build and expand opportunities for students, and this is your chance to learn more about our District's accomplishments and vision for the important work ahead.

a.title: Go to comments for You're invited: 2020 State of our Schools breakfast Feb. 25

img.alt: Black History Month: Follow us on social media for school snapshots

a.span: Black History Month: Follow us on social media for school snapshots

div.p: During Black History Month, we’ll highlight examples of teachers and school communities working to expand understanding of African American experiences, voices, and contributions - histories that deserve celebration far beyond four weeks in February.

a.title: Go to comments for Black History Month: Follow us on social media for school snapshots

img.alt: VIDEOS: Cordova High students deliver TED-style speeches

a.span: VIDEOS: Cordova High students deliver TED-style speeches

div.p: Those viral TED Talk videos you see in your social media feeds? Cordova High students in the school’s International Baccalaureate Programme recently created and delivered their own inspirational speeches before an audience of students, teachers, and community members.

a.title: Go to comments for VIDEOS: Cordova High students deliver TED-style speeches

img.alt: Navigator students shine in Sacramento Kings & VSP promo video

a.span: Navigator students shine in Sacramento Kings & VSP promo video

div.p: Hey, we recognize those kids! Big thanks to the Sacramento Kings and VSP Vision Care for choosing to shoot their latest promotional video in our very own Navigator Elementary School in Rancho Cordova.

a.title: Go to comments for Navigator students shine in Sacramento Kings & VSP promo video

img.alt: PHOTOS: Folsom, Vista students serve seniors for the holidays

a.span: PHOTOS: Folsom, Vista students serve seniors for the holidays

div.p: Student government leaders from Folsom and Vista Del Lago high schools, as well as the Interact Club from Folsom Lake and Folsom high schools, recently delivered baskets filled with snacks, games, puzzles and personal needs items for the residents at Park Folsom Senior Retirement Community.

a.title: Go to comments for PHOTOS: Folsom, Vista students serve seniors for the holidays
